question: A 22-year-old Air-force test pilot presents after flying a sortie. Eye examination shows?
exp: Ans. (a) Subconjunctival hemorrhage.The history of test pilot in air force leads to possibility of G force acting on the subconjunctival vessels leading to their rupture and subsequent hemorrhage.

question: Most common foreign body to cause penetrating injury to ciliary body
exp: Ans. (b) Hammer and chisel Ref: A.K. Khurana 6th ed. /163, 437

question: In case of xeropthalmia secondary to Vitamin A deficiency, what does X2 indicate according to WHO:
exp: Ans.(c) Corneal xerosisRef: A.K. Khurana 6th ed. /468* Xeropthalmia: all the ocular manifestation of Vitamin A deficiency.* First clinical sign of Vitamin A deficiency: Conjunctival Xerosis* First clinical symptom of vitamin A deficiency: Night blindnessWHO Classification of XeropthalmiaCLASSSIGNSX1AConjunctival xerosisX1BConjunctival xerosis with bitot's spotX2Corneal xerosisX3ACorneal xerosis with ulcerationX3BKeratomalacia
